result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyrone T Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:09 AM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing. Defendant Tyrone T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Tyrone T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Abbey Nickolie in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court notes a plea questionnaire has been filed and recites the offer as listed in the document.  State and Defense confirm the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1, Court finds defendant guilty of Count 1.  Court orders Count 2 be dismissed and read in.  Court also orders case 22CF535 be dismissed and read into this case.  Court notes this is a Branch 2 matter and inquires if parties would prefer to have sentencing before Branch 2 or proceed today before this court.  State is prepared to proceed to sentencing today.  Atty. Hughes is prepared to sentencing today.

Sentencing arguments made by the State.
Sentencing arguments made by Atty. Hughes.


COUNT 1: 
The Court Orders the Following:

Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:

3 Years & 6 Months Imprisonment (33 Days Credit IF revoked)
-	1 Year & 6 Months of Initial Confinement
-	2 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program IF revoked.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program IF revoked.

Term of Probation: 2 Years - Court will allow for early termination after 12 Months with Agent Approval and as long as restitution is paid in full.

Conditions of Probation/Extended Supervision (IF revoked):
-	Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
-	Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent;
-	No contact with Home Depot (22CF535) and Walmart listed in the Criminal Complaint.
-	AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Condition Time: 60 Days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion (Huber privileges at the Agent's discretion)

RESTITUTION: $1,152.46 to be paid to Home Depot  (resulting from 22CF535);

COSTS:  Waived by the Court.

DNA Surcharge: $250.00;

DNA Sample ordered and to be provided immediately if in custody or within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

Total costs/fine/forfeiture:  to be paid as a condition of probation. Failure to pay;  will result in a civil judgment.

Felony warnings, immigration warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.

Waukesha County Jail Inmate Communication Form dated 9/22/2022 from defendant requesting a signature bond.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/26/2022 - The defendant will need to work with his attorney to file a motion.**
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Letter from Attorney Hughes requesting that the upcoming status hearings be converted to plea and sentencing hearings in both of the defendant's cases, or an earlier court date if possible.
**Reviewed by Judge Dorow on 9/23/2022 - Due to the Court's calendar during November, the clerk will work to find a sooner date with a different court official for plea/sentencing.**

9:18 AM Defendant Tyrone T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Tyrone T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin. The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary. Waive reading of Information. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED. Bail remains as fixed. The date before the Trial Court shall remain as previously set.

9:01 AM Defendant Tyrone T Moore in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Tyrone T Moore.  Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Cases called for status. 
Defense requests Preliminary Hearing be set within 10 days in 22CF535. The other case will tagalong. 
Both cases set for further proceedings in November.
Hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on September 21, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
